conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on sphere A to determine \(\frac{q}{d}\)
Sphere A is on an inclined plane, and sphere B is to the right at the same height, separated by distance d
Identify forces acting on sphere A: gravitational force (mg), electrostatic force (F), normal force (\(N_A\)), and tension in the wire (zero)
Gravitational force can be broken into components parallel (\(mg \sin \theta\)) and perpendicular (\(mg \cos \theta\)) to the inclined plane
Electrostatic force is given by Coulomb's Law: \(F = k \frac{q^2}{d^2}\)
Since sphere A is stationary, net force in both directions must be zero
Parallel to the plane: Electrostatic force must balance the component of gravitational force: \(F \cos \theta = mg \sin \theta\)
